items.content_html:
1. syntax corrections in the Syntax section
  2. locales -> locale (except for the ID)
  3. removed Checking for support for locales and options arguments section that was predicated on lack of browser support
  4. grammar and punctuation corrections
  5. other text revisions for clarity and readability

MDN URL
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Date/toLocaleTimeString
items.title: text revisions to JS .toLocaleTimeString() doc

items.content_html:
What was wrong/why is this fix needed? (quick summary only)

There is a code snippet in the "Rendering and the WebXR frame animation callback" of the WebXR Device API docs that attempts to request a reference space using a session mode value. I have updated it to use local as that is the most general but if that is not correct, I am happy to update that to the intended type based on any feedback.

MDN URL of main page changed

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WebXR_Device_API/Rendering

Issue number (if there is an associated issue)

Anything else that could help us review it
items.title: Fixing Parameter in WebXR Code Example

items.content_html:
This PR removes all <div=class="hidden"> elements from the JS documentation, except for the ones that are really part of a live sample, that are dealt with in #3718.

These are almost all boilerplate notes attached to BCD or interactive examples, although there are a few more targeted comments, that we might want to convert into HTML comments?

Assuming we do want to do this, but not in one huge PR, I can easily enough split it up into bits.
items.title: Remove hidden divs from JavaScript docs

items.content_html:
I encountered this page today, and was confused by the line

The isNaN() function determines whether a value is NaN or not. Note, coercion inside the isNaN function has interesting rules; you may alternatively want to use Number.isNaN(), as defined in ECMAScript 2015.

Due to the typography, the full stop of not. Note became almost impossible to spot. Shall we had a <div class="notecard note"> here? How would that impact the abstract for SEO? I decided to adjust the wording a bit, to not make it read like not Note.

While I was at it, I updated the code samples to drop var in favour of const.

What was wrong/why is this fix needed? (quick summary only)

MDN URL of main page changed

Issue number (if there is an associated issue)

Anything else that could help us review it
items.title: Minor edits on isNaN()

items.content_html:
createHTMLDocument always returns an HTMLDocument according to the spec.
So I changed the link to point to that documentation.

The link I changed pointed to a more generic type.

items.content_html:
Working on #3455 this PR:

  1. Moves the non-standard :-moz-ui-valid to :user-valid
  2. Updates that page to be correct as to the spec, adds an example
  3. Updates user-invalid as it still referred to the moz property it was moved from
  4. Adds an example to user-invalid

I'm next going to do the BCD and syntax entries for the pseudo, which currently will show as an error.
items.title: updating user-valid and user-invalid

items.content_html:
This removes Guide/Events/Mutation_events as part of fixing #2245.

In summary, the guide topic is almost identical to the webapi page MutationEvent. So this mostly just deletes the guide page, updates links to MutationEvent, and adds a redirect to MutationEvent
items.title: Remove guide mutation events
